newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates sink on flowback funds.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates sink on flowback funds.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates sank at mid-session on Tuesday, reflecting the peak monthly period for money returning to the banking system following early-month outflows, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate dipped below 6.0 percent and stood at 5.994 against Tuesday's 6.081 close, still outside the central bank's 5.0-5.5 percent target zone, with 30-day commercial paper stable at 5.90-6.00 percent against 6.00.
Dealers said the market largely shrugged off the central bank's announced plan to issue T$8.0 billion in negotiable certificates of deposit later on Tuesday.

In an apparent strategy to stave off overheating in the red-hot stock market, central bank deputy governor Hsu Chia-tung said on Monday the bank would continue to issue NCDs to mop up banking system liquidity.
In the bond market, the 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 6.1450-6.1460 percent against 6.1430-6.1450 and the seven-year 85/3 bond yield was at 5.8700 against 5.8500.
